sentences.en: Explorer, , polymath, friend of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Thomas Jefferson and Simon Bolívar, Alexander von Humboldt was one of the greatest scientists of the 19th century.
sentences.cn: 探险家，博学者，歌德、杰弗逊和玻利瓦尔的朋友，洪堡是十九世纪最伟大的科学家之一，他的想法至今都没有过时。

sentences.en: If Charles I owned a real Leonardo before he was executed in 1649, this means our national love affair with the Renaissance polymath has been going on for almost 400 years.
sentences.cn: 若查理一世在1649年被处决前拥有一幅达·芬奇真迹，那意味着我们国家和达·芬奇这位文艺复兴时的博学家有过近400年的渊源。

sentences.en: Mr English, an associate editor of the Guardian, is a polymath who wears his learning lightly.
sentences.cn: 英格力士先生是《卫报》的副编辑，是一位略显才华的博学者。

sentences.en: Shen Kuo (1031~1095) was a Chinese scientist, polymath, general, diplomat, and financial officer who was the inventor of compasses for navigation.
sentences.cn: 沈括（1031~1095 ），科学家、博学者、将军、外交家、财务官员，发明了指南针。

sentences.en: The polymath Doyle tried to kill off Holmes at the turn of the century, but public outcry encouraged the author to resuscitate the archetypal detective in 1901's The Hound of the Baskervilles.
sentences.cn: 上世纪初，博学的柯南道尔曾尝试让福尔摩斯在自己的作品中死去，但公众的强烈抗议迫使他在1901年创作《巴斯克维尔庄园的猎犬》时将这位超级神探复活过来。

trans.tran_en: someone who has a lot of knowledge about many different subjects
